channel.title: CVE Feed for brainstormforce -- Starter Templates — Elementor, WordPress & Beaver Builder Templates
channel.description: The latest CVEs for brainstormforce -- Starter Templates — Elementor, WordPress & Beaver Builder Templates

item.title: CVE-2024-1467|2024-06-04T17:59:34.875Z -- brainstormforce -- starter%20templates%20%E2%80%94%20elementor%2C%20wordpress%20%26%20beaver%20builder%20templates
item.description: The Starter Templates — Elementor, WordPress & Beaver Builder Templates plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.1.6 via the ai_api_request(). This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.

item.title: CVE-2024-4630|2024-06-04T17:56:04.835Z -- brainstormforce -- starter%20templates%20%E2%80%94%20elementor%2C%20wordpress%20%26%20beaver%20builder%20templates
item.description: The Starter Templates — Elementor, WordPress & Beaver Builder Templates plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘custom_upload_mimes’ function in versions up to, and including, 4.2.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
